description: From French faïence, named after the city Faenza in Italy, where it was made in the 16th century.

entries.meaning: A type of tin-glazed earthenware ceramic.
examples: The word Majolica, or Maiolica  […]  was applied to all Stanniferous faience of Italy and Spain.

entries.meaning: (archaeology) The beads and small ornaments of the eastern Mediterranean. (Of bronze and iron age manufacture using frit technology.)
